channel.title: Windows 8 Beta
channel.description:
Released two days ago, I've just installed it and first impressions are strange, but pretty and intuitive.
I did use the developer preview when that was first released and I wasn't too keen, however it's changed a fair bit since then, as far as I can see, a lot of which is visual changes, such as the lack of the start button, the looks of the window title header, and the metro interface is now much higher resolution, which is a definite improvement.
Anybody else given it a try yet? For anyone needing a link: [url=http://windows.microsoft.com/en-US/windows-8/download?ocid=W_MSC_W8P_DevCenter_MetroApps_EN-US]http://windows.microsoft.com/en-US/windows-8/download?ocid=W_MSC_W8P_DevCenter_MetroApps_EN-US[/url]
Real simple install too, it even let me keep all my programs installed and settings exactly as they were :)
[URL=http://imageshack.us/photo/my-images/198/captureuqj.png/][IMG]http://img198.imageshack.us/img198/6028/captureuqj.th.png[/img][/URL]
[URL=http://imageshack.us/photo/my-images/803/capture2m.png/][IMG]http://img803.imageshack.us/img803/6596/capture2m.th.png[/img][/URL]
[URL=http://imageshack.us/photo/my-images/842/capture3bp.png/][IMG]http://img842.imageshack.us/img842/6655/capture3bp.png[/img][/URL]

item.title: Windows 8 Beta
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

jmood128:

If they can make Windows 8 with the performance of Linux then I would switch to 8, if not then 7 will stay.

I must say so far it’s a lot nippier than 7, just general folder loading and opening speeds, as well as startup, heard the sleep and hibernate is good too but I haven’t tried. And it’s not because it’s a new install either, as it kept my registry and programs installed.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Daginith wrote:

[quote=“SilentCJ, post:28, topic:434911”][quote author=Ix Soulcist xI link=topic=537631.msg3931816#msg3931816 date=1330734362]
This needs to remain on Cellphones if anything, not on computers.
[/quote]
There’s no denying that the future will consist of high powered portable touch screen tablet-like devices, probably with detachable keyboards, Microsoft are just adapting their software to the latest technology.[/quote]

BREAKING-NEWS: Apple Sues Microsoft for using their copyrighted touch technology.

Yeah, i don’t think this is going to work too well for Microsoft…

item.title: Windows 8 Beta
item.dc:creator: @Daginith Daginith
item.description:
@Daginith wrote:

[quote=“SilentCJ, post:24, topic:434911”][quote author=Daginith link=topic=537631.msg3931740#msg3931740 date=1330732607]

Honestly it’s just like Windows 7 with a custom theme, start button removed and a touch interface slapped on top, it’s not all bad

they only took out the aspect that made it look like a desktop computer…

Well yes, I probably wouldn’t pay to upgrade, but I’m stuck with this now until it runs out, or when I feel like doing a full wipe and clean install of 7 again. 2TB of data so that’s not a quick process

Haha, i just dual-boot out of it, i never use windows these days, unless i want to play some games WINE doesn’t support.
[/quote]
Oh I have it dual booted too don’t worry
Mostly just use it for drive formatting and partitioning though, nothing beats gparted.[/quote]

gParted for the win, haha.

Read full topic
